Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ranalexin   (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; ZZP; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: active as the WT against S. aureus or MRSA (MIC 4 ug/ml), P.aeruginosa (MIC 128 ug/ml), E. coli (MIC 32 ug/ml).In vitro toxicity: The recombinant ranalexin is also cytotoxic in HeLa and COS7 human cancer cells (IC50 =13-15 ug/ml)(Appl Microbiol Biotechnol. 2012).Structure:  In membrane-mimetic TFE or DPC micelles, residues 8-15 are helical (edited 11/4/2007 GW).Animal model:mouse:bacteria: In mice for systemic infection, the peptide showed synergistic effect against MRSA with antistaphylococcal endopeptidase (Desbois AP et al., 2010 Int J Antimicrob Agents 35: 559-65).Synergy:enzyme: see above.Updated 10/12/2012; 9/2024 GW.
Literature Information.Author: Clark DP, Durell S, Maloy WL, Zasloff M1994
Literature Information.Title: Ranalexin, a novel antimicrobial peptide from bullfrog (Rana catesbeiana) skin, structurally related to the bacterial antibiotic, polymyxin
